page.title: 11Public Services in Bramdean
page.content: There is a bus service connecting the village with nearby towns, which runs 5 times per day with no service after 5.30pm or on Sunday. There is one mail delivery per day (except Sundays), with collections twice per day; and a public telephone box. A daily milk and newspaper delivery is available, but some houses collect newspapers from a communal collecting point. A foot clinic visits once a month. The nearest doctor's surgery is 4 miles; the nearest ambulance 10 miles and the nearest fire station 4 miles. A police constable lives with his family in the village, in a small sub-police station. Telephones, mains water and electricity are available to all homes, but there is no mains gas. There is no mains drainage in the area, each house has its own septic tank or cess pit.
